alert.note: Alert for Allen; Barren; Monroe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 2:43PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Monroe, southeastern Allen and southeastern Barren Counties through 215 PM CDT... At 143 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Scottsville, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of western Monroe, southeastern Allen and southeastern Barren Counties, including the following locations... Oak Forest, Forkton, Gum Tree, Maynard, Freetown, Sulphur Lick, Gamaliel, Tracy, Lamb and Forest Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
